page.title: 12ALTCAR TAVR CAMP
page.content: This{Army Camp}was established during the{1st World War.}Between the Wars the{West Lancashire Territorial and{Volunteer Reserve Association}were given the land by{Lord Derby}and the camp as we see it today was built. The camp today is used by Regular and T.A. units of the Army, Royal Air Force and Royal Navy as well as by Cadet Forces. It can claim to be one of the leading centres in the country for small arms training as it has an electronic target range. It is administered by{Civil Servants and commanded by a retired Colonal. The sand dune areas give an excellent training area and in the{1939-'45 period were used for both{tank}and {infantry training.}The area is surrounded by firing point lookouts when exercises are in progress. The Queen visited on the 25th June 1985.
